creator: aj@drfloob.com
text:
As the title says, using both 2.6 and Nightly r1325640, filename prefixes will not execute functions or parse variables. I have tried:

C:\${__samplerName}_
C:\${__samplerName()}_
C:\${__TestPlanName}_
C:\${__time}_
C:\${TIMESTART.MS}

This "save Responses to a file" listener is placed in the tree as a child of a "HTTP Request" sampler which does have a name.

creator: aj@drfloob.com
text:
I should add, the results of the Listener were files named literally:

${__samplerName}_1.xml
${__samplerName()}_1.xml
${__TestPlanName}_1.xml
${__time}_1.xml
${TIMESTART.MS}1.xml

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Created attachment 28613
Test Plan as described by reporter

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
I tried to reproduce issue with current trunk 1326420 with attached plan I was not able to do it.

Please reopen issue with a Test Plan that reproduces issue or comment if it was an issue in your plan.

creator: aj@drfloob.com
text:
Thank you for your help, Phillipe. This is still exhibiting the problem in nightly r1325640. I had to modify your Test Plan since I am on Windows XP, and am unsure where the /data/ folder would map to (if anywhere).

I'll attach 2 test plans for you: one which exhibits the problem, and one which does not.

In summary, what I've found is that with Filename prefix = ${__samplerName}_ alone, the function is executed and the file HTTP Request_1.plain is written to the jmeter\bin folder . With Filename prefix = C:\${__samplerName}_, the file ${__samplerName}_1.plain is written to the C:\ folder.

creator: aj@drfloob.com
text:
Created attachment 28614
A Test Plan in which the filename does not execute the samplerName function (on Windows XP 32 bit, using nightly r1325640)

Created attachment 28615
A Test Plan in which the filename *does* execute the samplerName function (on Windows XP 32 bit, using nightly r1325640)
creator: aj@drfloob.com
aj@drfloob.com
text:
(In reply to comment #4)
> Thank you for your help, Phillipe.

I spelled your name wrong. Sorry, Philippe.

I have a few other Windows machines, if testing on them would be of any help to you. I don't have access to a *nix machine at the moment.

Hello,
This is not a bug in fact, it is due to the fact that you use:
C:\${__samplerName}_
So this escapes $ char so variable or function is not interpreted.

To fix this put:
C:\\${__samplerName}_

Next time ask a question on user mailing list before submitting a bug so that people can help you.
By the way maybe you should submit this question with the answer on user mailing list to share information.

Thanks if you do it.

Regards
Philippe M.
http://www.ubik-ingenierie.com
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
